isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - STOPMASTER WEDGE TYPE BRAKE - INSTALL - WEDGE ALIGNMENT

svcproc.title: WEDGE ALIGNMENT
svcproc.para: Whenever the air chamber is removed from the brake, the wedge assembly may also become dislodged. Before reinstalling the air chamber, reposition the wedge assembly so that the rollers and roller cage are engaged in the plunger slots ( Figure 42). On newer brake assemblies, this is accomplished automatically by simply aligning the two ears on the wedge spring retainer with corresponding grooves in the wedge bore of the plunger housing. On older assemblies, the wedge head must be aligned manually so that the rollers engage the plunger slots properly. In either case, proper alignment can be checked by pushing on the wedge rod, while visually checking for shoe and plunger lift.
